title: Call of Cthulhu: Dark Corners of the Earth playthrough — Part 1
description: Starting this up after Nosferatu. Been interested in playing this for a long time, so I'm finally getting around to it. So far, it's pretty cool. More narrative than I thought, but that's actually a good thing.
gameName: Call of Cthulhu: Dark Corners of the Earth

fragments.text: Wish I could resub on mobile, it's at like 2 years at least
just subscribed for 69 months in a row!
*Guy subs for 11 months, Has heart attack*
Some top boys are like 80+ months
The stream has been live for: 7 minutes 1 second
please turn on emote sounds again q3Excellent
In that case it should be
ankhbot has cooldown for them doesnt it
the only horror here is the squeak on those doors
I'm still gonna recommend Cryostasis, nice and spooky.
are you punching them or having a dance off
I tell ya, the minimum requirement for me to be scared in an first-person perspective game is that it has tank controls
bust a jig and watch them seizure to death
LordZergeant shoots Tryedz in the right hand!
Tryedz shoots LordZergeant in the right ass cheek!
you gotta hammer the stake in
maybe add some garlic to it
hammer the stake in with more stakes
why did you eat raw garlic coob
I'm gonna go to lunch now, but then I'll be back!
LordZergeant shoots Pavichokche in the left ass cheek!
yeah that felt a little anticlimactic
it drew a circle around Buster
I got Hydrophobia, Sniper Elite V2, Fallout 4
I feel speedrunning this would be difficult
did you just punch out a gargoyle?
Sharp I think some places in this game are randomly generated. So I wouldn't be surprised if a speed run of this would be difficult because of that.
No cause you were discussing someone running this in around 20 minutes
are the enemies spawning back or are these all new areas?
it's funny how this game preceded all the procedural generation craze
you can easily see an indie game with the same concept released a couple years ago
and the doggo wanted to guard him
it generates the entire castle at once though no?
I mean, you only had to kill 500 other dogs to save the one, but still thoughtful
@Tryedz Nah, it also randomly spawns the enemies and stuff
I'm trying to figure out if that was a pun
it's a bit too late at this point
but the dog is ok and thats all that matters WotInTarnation
The dog ending, the only one that doesn't crash
he didnt expect that to be enemy dog WotInTarnation
I had that happen to me once
doors just slammed on my neck
fortunately they also hit the shoulders so it wasn't completely shut
g l i t c h e d
wouldn't an anti-vampire throw up blood or something
doesn't seem to mind, I guess
getting in lost in video games, what a novel idea
next time you should STEAK your dog, not STAKE it
in my defense I don't think one would use the word "stake" as a verb to shove an actual stake into someone or something
other than like, staking out some kind of perimeter with stakes
what about stake your dog for a walk?
maybe one should not, but I'm pretty sure they do.
well then I'm gonna use steak as a verb, so there
maybe there was a way around his um, where he was locked
like maybe some roof walking again
Are you a high level priest?
Do you ever run out of bless?
that running sound is pretty hilarious
his legs must be really short
Blessed before he hit the ground
is that the icon of sin?
your dad could easily be in the NBA
and you can see the white background
but does it still have a steak in its heart
that's because your graphics drivers are not handling texture edges the way hardware at the time did
or that which is a smart response
aha, it's holes in the geometry
qDTH shoots leparklez in the chest!
I think that is not the "void". it's the fog being a function of distance on the z buffer
I thought that was just typical horror endgame aesthetic
the house is being pulled into the void
so the void is simply the fog adding up when you have holes in the geometry
Subscribe to my Youtube for playthrough and speedrun videos: https://www.youtube.com/user/cubeface21
Oh, so you freed the doggo
man this house must be hella DANK
the moisture must make it hard to breathe
does being outside in a fog make it hard to breathe?
They say vampires can turn into mist
like, a tiny bit I guess
but inside moisture can be bad for you
inside moisture is good for you
and this house is like, mostly wood
Can you play as a dog instead ?
well, then it's the mildew and not the fog, isn't it
yeah it seems the procedural generation is breaking a bit
alucard has a mist form in Castlevania: Symphony of the Night
oh shit, maybe the vampire is in the ENTIRE HOUSE
I only knew vampires can turn into mist from Robert Asprin's books Thingkenofquake
well, all those forms are forms that vampires supposedly can take
that's true to bram stoker's dracula
according to well documented studies of actual vampires
anne rice is the leading expert on vampirology
in Dracula from 1992, Gary Oldman turns into a wolf and a wolf man
yeah but dracula has many-eyed holy-shit fucking-god form
it was like this in the book
except for that god aweful performance by Keanu Reeves
haha. I like Keanu, but he even shit talks his own performance in that movie
anybody who has seen reeves in "to the bones" netflix production will never believe in the matrix again
i watched the one with bela lugosi recently
"I'll just hide this stake right here"
and bramstokers dracula is a fucking classic
qDTH shoots ray_caster in the forehead!
coob spent years mimicking keanu's voice acting
30 days of night is cool too
looks pretty good so far actually
I wonder if other religions have horror games that use their iconography as part of the mythos
like, are there buddhist ghosts that can only be exorcised by improving the self?
if there isn't, you should make one, Capn
There aren't ghosts per se in buddhism
whats the bad guy in scientology
But I guess pretas can be seen as such
there are nether beings from shittier worlds
Usually if you're a bad person you'll be reborn as one of these nether beings
So improving the self certainly keeps at least one from spawning, in a way Thingkenofquake
There is lots of japanese horror games that heavily include their mythos
even if it isn't super obvious because they are spooky ghosts half the time
Anyway, there's a game called cosmology of Kyoto, it's chock full of buddhist and other japanese mythos
only one thing left to do
will you beat the time if you manage to enter the door?
you still have the save from the part where it skips to 6am yeah?
malachi, you're nothing but a STD-ridden knob-goblin

it's like 300 days if you get them the caravans

must be a world record or something
did you like try to collect everything?
I mean hey, you got more out of it, that's a good thing

I mean, I did stealth quite a bit, so that took more time than tanking
that death animation, or lack of

not enough sand in the coffin, I think

don't question these things with your logic
